name: v0.5.2-pre1 Alpha
body:
What's new:

 - Real-time compilation
   - Your code automatically compiles in the background
   - Errors and warnings are underlined in your code
   - The problem overview screen (to the right of the console) shows all errors and warnings found in your code
   - Improved preprocessor
 - Improved file selection
 - Bug fixes and improvements

name: v0.5.1 Alpha
body:
What's new:

 - Preview mode runs sketches without installing them
   - You must install the APDE Sketch Previewer once, but then you can run sketches without installation indefinitely
   - Preview mode is available as another target, along with wallpapers, watch faces, and VR
 - Support for the new Processing sound library
 - Undo and redo are more accessible
 - Ability to bypass screen overlay warning
 - Lots of bug fixes

These changes are driven by GSoC '18.

name: v0.5.0 Alpha
body:
What's new:
 - Run sketches targeting wallpapers, watch faces, and VR!
   - Change targets by pressing the new button next to the run button
 - Update to Android mode 4.0
 - Lots of bug fixes

Notes:

To run watch faces, you must install APDE from the Play Store on your Wear OS watch, or sideload the wear companion APK attached below.

VR supports Google Cardboard and Daydream headsets.

These changes are driven by GSoC '18. Special thanks to Sara Di Bartolomeo, Andres Colubri, and the Processing Foundation!

name: v0.4.1 Alpha
body:
What's new:

 - Fix most code deletion bugs
 - Android multi-window support on 7.0+ (Nougat)
 - Timer-based autosave
 - Many other bug fixes and improvements

name: v0.4.0 Alpha
body:
What's new:
- Material design
- Android 7.0 (Nougat) build crash fixed
- Find in Reference
- New temporary sketch model
- Faster build times
- Processing core sync with Android Mode 3.0.2 (0253)
- Processing internals sync with Processing 3.0.1 (0247)
- Updated default sketch icons
- Lots of bug fixes and smaller improvements

Note: This release drops support for Android 2.3.3 Gingerbread (API level 10),
which the desktop version has also done. The new minimum Android version
is Android 4.0.3 Ice Cream Sandwich (API level 15).

name: v0.3.3 Alpha
body:
What's new:
- Large set of examples (must be downloaded)
- Basic Git integration
- Find/replace
- Support all external storage locations
- What's new and about screens
- Java 1.6 compiler compliance
- AAPT build failure fixed
- Library manager crash fixed
- Conway example fixed
- Lots of other bug fixes

Note: This release adds the permissions INTERNET and 
ACCESS_NETWORK_STATE that are required for the examples and Git.

name: v0.3.2 Alpha bug-fix 2
body:
Fix another big bug in 0.3.2...

This is the last one! I promise!

name: v0.3.2 Alpha bug-fix
body:
This release fixes two bugs found in 0.3.2:
- Build process is broken on 2.2.3
- Static mode sketches won't build

name: v0.3.2 Alpha
body:
What's new:
- Undo / Redo
- Android 5.0 (Lollipop) support
- Console output (via log broadcaster)
- Improved build system
- Processing core sync with latest version of Android Mode (0232)
- Processing internals sync with latest version (3.0a4)
  - Improved pre-processor and auto formatter
- Wizard for changing sketch icon
- Support for .JAVA files
- DX Dexer tool in Library Manager
- Two finger swipe between tabs

name: v0.3.1 Alpha
body:
Changes:
- Added "Export Signed Package" tool
  - Supports the creation and loading of existing keystores and signing keys / certificates
- Added "Export Eclipse Project" tool
- Support x86 and MIPS processor architectures

name: v0.3.0 Alpha
body:
Changes:
- New nested file manager
  - Includes library examples and recent sketches
- Tools
  - Auto Format and Import Library are now tools
  - Added color selector tool
- Improved formatting
  - Added Comment / uncomment
  - Added Increase / decrease indent
- Support loading external sketches

name: v0.2.4 Alpha
body:
Changes:
- Support for contributed libraries
- Added Library Manager, supports installation of zipped libraries (includes pre-build dexing of library JARs)
- Support for code and code-dex folders in the sketch folder

name: v0.2.3 Alpha
body:
This release brings some new features as well as a couple of bug fixes.

Changes:
- Added full support for devices without an external storage (Sketchbook and build can be moved to internal storage)
- New fragment-based Settings screen
- New special character insertion tray for use with software keyboards
- Improved coding assistance - auto indentation works on more devices and code block completion has been implemented

Bug Fixes:
- Two bugs causing tabs to overwrite each other have been resolved

name: v0.2.2 Alpha
body:
This release includes lots of bug fixes and a couple of usability improvements.

Changes:
- Added Auto Format
- Improved speed of the Syntax Highlighter
- Added the tab key

Bug Fixes:
- Data folder not included in application
- Sketch Properties crashes for new sketch
- Some tabs overwriting each other
- Some error messages not displaying properly
- Many more...

name: v0.2.1 Alpha
body:
This release comes largely with the fix of issue #1 - hardware accelerated sketches are now fully operational. In addition, there have been a couple of improvements:
- Editor bracket matching (`(` and `)`, `{` and `}`, and `[` and `]`)
- Fixes for some crashes on Samsung devices
- Prevent the user from modifying examples

name: v0.2.0 Alpha
body:
This release encompasses the following changes:
- Added a small set of examples
- Significantly improved the syntax highlighter
- Now works on 10" tablets and tablets running Honeycomb

Please note that some of the examples may not work properly as they have been scaled up, especially on higher screen densities. The "Yellowtail" example is currently broken due to issue #1. This is a top priority, and should (hopefully) be fixed soon.

If APDE takes a little bit longer to load than usual (only the first launch), then this is because the examples have been updated and the editor needs to extract the files from the APK file.

The new syntax highlighter resolves many issues that were found in the previous one; however, it is also slightly slower. You can disable it from the Settings menu if you find it too slow for your needs. It will continue to be optimized in the future.

name: v0.1.1 Alpha
body:
A notable bug involving the build process on some devices has been fixed. Some usability changes have been introduced.

With this release, the signing key has been changed (to make it easier for the app to change hands in the future). If you have previously installed APDE, you must uninstall the old version before installing the new one. You will _not_ lose your sketches. This is a temporary inconvenience that will (hopefully) not have to be repeated.

APDE is now listed [on Google Play](https://play.google.com/store/apps/details?id=com.calsignlabs.apde), primarily as a means of receiving bug reports. It is highly recommended that you install the app from Google Play because if you encounter bugs, you can then submit a stack trace directly. Hopefully it will be possible to iron out some of the bugs with this change. Of course, the download will still be hosted on GitHub for the off change that someone would prefer to download it here.

name: v0.1 Alpha
body:
The initial alpha release of APDE. This release serves as the working copy of the project for those interested in trying it out.

In order to install this APK file, you must enable installation from external sources in your device's settings (typically found in Settings > Applications > Development).

Documentation for how to use this app can be found in the README file.
Support for the release is available on the [forum post](http://forum.processing.org/two/discussion/2342/android-pde-create-and-run-sketches-on-an-android-device#Item_1).
